image_2.merged_entity_name: CHAPTER SEVENTEEN: THE MAN WITH TWO FACES
image_2.description: The title of a chapter in a book, suggesting a narrative involving a character with dual identities or conflicting aspects, which in this context refers to the revelation of Quirrell's true nature and his connection to Lord Voldemort.
source_image_entities: CHAPTER SEVENTEEN: THE MAN WITH TWO FACES

image_3.description: Diagon Alley is a location in the Harry Potter series, mentioned in the context of Jim Kay's illustrations, and is a shopping area in the Wizarding World where magical items are purchased.

image_4.description: Diagon Alley is a whimsical and magical street with a variety of shops and buildings, characterized by its crooked architecture and vibrant atmosphere. It is a shopping area in the Wizarding World where magical items are purchased and is mentioned in the context of Jim Kay's illustrations.

image_5.description: Hogwarts Express is the train that transports students to and from Hogwarts, as seen in image_5.
Platform Nine and Three-Quarters is the magical platform at King's Cross Station where the Hogwarts Express departs from, as featured in image_5.

image_7.description: Hermione Granger is a young witch with curly hair, wearing a black robe with red and gold trim, holding a wand in her right hand and a glowing lantern in her left hand. She is a high-achieving student who is friends with Harry and Ron and is interacting with Harry and Uncle Vernon.

image_8.description: Norwegian Ridgeback, also known as Norbert the Norwegian Ridgeback, is a dragon mentioned in the Harry Potter series, owned briefly by Hagrid.

image_9.description: Norwegian Ridgeback, also known as Norbert the Norwegian Ridgeback, is a term mentioned in the Harry Potter series, likely referring to a type of dragon, specifically Norbert who is owned briefly by Hagrid.
